flawed_nl_solution:
In 2 minutes, 12 liters of water flow into the bathtub and 2 liters (2 minutes x 1 liter/minute ) escape.
This will leave 12 - 2 = <<12-2=6>>6 liters of water every two minutes
We can divide the number of liters by the number of minutes to find the average flow per minute, which is 6 / 2 = <<6/2=3>>3 liters per minute
To fill the tub, it will take 120 liters / 3 liters/min = <<120/3=40>>40 min

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 10, not 6. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
